titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I wrote a sermon for use in Leeds on Friday when I have undertaken to preach in aid of some organisations of girls' clubs which
presides over. Also I wrote a number of letters including one to

. I attended Evensong, and went for a short walk. After dinner I read through the Lecture on the Fire of London, (originally written for the Newcastle Lit: & Phil) which I have promised to deliver in Leeds.
The papers report the deaths of
, who is in command of the British army in Mesopotamia. The last is very regrettable on public grounds.
address for the next two letters which must go off on the 24
respectively to c/o. Cotts & Co. Capetown, who would appear to watch the interests of S.S. Titan.
